content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to James Semple, 1 I now give notice that on monday next or some day thereafter I shall ask leave to

introduce abillentitled an act to limit the jurisdiction of Justices of the Peace—2
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to James Semple, 1 I now give notice that on monday next or some day thereafter I shall ask leave to
introduce abillentitled an act to limit the jurisdiction of Justices of the Peace—2

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the entirety of the text on page one. Lincoln presented this
                  notice in the House of Representatives on December 5, 1834.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835. 9th G. A., 1st sess., 47.
2Lincoln introduced the bill in theHouse of Representativeson December 9, 1834. The bill did not become law.Illinois HouseJournal. 1835. 9th G. A., 1st sess., 84.

structured_content.text: Abraham Lincoln to James Semple, [5 December 1834]1

I now give notice that on monday next or some day thereafter I shall ask leave to
               introduce abillentitled an act to limit the jurisdiction of Justices of the Peace—2
